3.8.1.title: Overview
3.8.1.content:
Gas handling equipment safely separates and disposes of gas from drilling returns:

**Components:**
- Mud Gas Separator (MGS / Poor Boy Degasser)
- Degasser (vacuum type)
- Flare system
- Gas detection systems

**Purpose:**
- Remove gas from mud before it reaches shale shakers
- Prevent gas accumulation in mud pits
- Safely dispose of separated gas
- Protect personnel from gas exposure

3.8.2.title: Mud Gas Separator (Poor Boy)
3.8.2.content:
**Function:**
Separates gas from mud at atmospheric pressure by gravity and baffles:
- Mud enters near top
- Falls through baffles, releasing gas
- Gas vents to atmosphere or flare
- Mud exits bottom to shakers or pits

**Capacity:**
- Must handle expected gas volumes during kill
- Sizing based on anticipated flow rates
- Critical for well control operations

**Location:**
- Downstream of choke manifold
- Before mud reaches shakers
- Vent line to safe location

**Limitations:**
- Cannot handle extremely high flow rates
- May overflow if capacity exceeded
- Atmospheric pressure only

3.8.3.title: Vacuum Degasser
3.8.3.content:
**Function:**
Removes dissolved and entrained gas from mud using vacuum:
- Mud passes through vacuum chamber
- Reduced pressure releases gas from mud
- More thorough than gravity separation

**Use:**
- Routine drilling operations
- Gas-cut mud cleanup
- After well control event to restore mud properties

**Not for Well Control:**
- Cannot handle high gas volumes during kill
- Use MGS during active well control
- Degasser for cleanup afterward

3.8.4.title: Flare System
3.8.4.content:
**Purpose:**
Safely burn separated gas:
- Burns off combustible gases
- Prevents accumulation
- Located away from rig

**Components:**
- Flare stack or boom
- Ignition system
- Flame arrestor
- Safety controls

**Operation:**
- Route gas from MGS to flare
- Ignite and maintain flame
- Monitor for flame-out

**Safety:**
- Locate downwind and away from operations
- Ensure adequate height/distance
- Monitor during use
- Have backup ignition

3.8.5.title: Gas Detection
3.8.5.content:
**Fixed Detectors:**
- Located throughout rig
- Continuous monitoring
- Alarm at set thresholds
- Key locations: shakers, pits, drill floor

**Portable Detectors:**
- For spot checks
- Entry into confined spaces
- Personal monitors for H2S areas

**Types:**
- Combustible gas (% LEL)
- H2S (ppm)
- CO2 (where applicable)

**Response:**
- Know alarm thresholds
- Have response procedures
- Evacuation routes identified
- Breathing apparatus available

3.8.6.title: Testing and Maintenance
3.8.6.content:
**MGS:**
- Visual inspection for integrity
- Verify vent line clear
- Check mud seal at bottom
- Inspect baffles if accessible

**Gas Detectors:**
- Calibrate per manufacturer requirements
- Test alarms regularly
- Replace sensors as needed
- Document all tests

**Flare:**
- Test ignition system
- Verify flame arrestor in place
- Check pilot light (if equipped)
- Inspect for damage
